title: Apple to Remove Blood-Oxygen Tool From Watches to Avoid Ban
description: The move is to get around a US ban stemming from a patent dispute with Masimo Corp.

title: The Remote Taiwanese Islands Where It Takes a Village to Keep Democracy Alive
description: As the world held its breath awaiting Taiwan’s 2024 presidential elections, residents of the Wuqiu Islands made the journey home to vote.

title: Here’s How Many Streets Are Probably Named After Martin Luther King Jr.
description: A look at how many streets are named after Martin Luther King Jr.

title: How Biden Can Stop Houthi Missile Attacks—Without Risking War
description: U.S. airstrikes have failed to deter Yemen's Houthis. But Biden is refusing to pursue the most obvious and peaceful approach.

title: Houthi Missile Hits American-Owned Cargo Ship Off Coast of Yemen
description: In response to strikes carried out in Yemen by the U.S. and U.K., Houthi rebels retaliated by attacking a U.S.-owned shipping container.

title: Fake 911 Report of Fire at the White House Triggers Emergency Response
description: President Joe Biden and his family were at Camp David.

title: Lloyd Austin Released From Hospital After Complications From Prostate Cancer Surgery He Kept Secret
description: Austin spent two weeks there to treat complications from surgery for prostate cancer

title: Inside Ron DeSantis’ Final Push in Iowa
description: The Florida Governor is relying on his ground game, and lowered expectations, to stay in the race

title: Why Iceland’s Volcano Eruption Was a ‘Black Day’ for the Country
description: Around 3,800 were evacuated ahead of Sunday's volcanic eruption amid a 'daunting period of upheaval'.

title: Hamas Airs Video With 3 Israeli Hostages and Says It Will Disclose Their Fate. Here’s What We Know
description: Sunday's video features Noa Argamani, Yossi Sharabi, and Itai Svirsky and a note that their fate will be discolosed 'tomorrow'.

title: At Davos, Conflict, Climate Change, and AI Get Top Billing as Leaders Converge for Elite Meeting
description: The to-do list of global priorities has grown for this year’s edition of the World Economic Forum gabfest that kicks off today.

title: A Surgeon General Report Once Cleared the Air About Smoking. Is It Time for One on Vaping?
description: Some public health experts say a similar report to one 60 years about the dangers of cigarettes could help clear the air about vaping.

title: The Problem With Comparing Today’s Activists to Martin Luther King Jr.
description: Recalling contemporary media coverage of the civil rights movement is a reminder that the deification of King has skewed public memory.

title: Trump Promised Retribution. He’s Not So Sure That’s What Iowa Voters Want.
description: Iowa will be the first test of Republican voter appetite for a pay-back presidency.

title: The World Could Get Its First Trillionaire Within 10 years, Oxfam Says
description: That's according to the anti-poverty group Oxfam International, which released its annual assessment of global inequalities ahead of Davos.

title: A Complete Guide to Tonight’s Emmy Awards
description: The Television Academy is honoring excellence in programming that premiered nationally between June 1, 2022, and May 31, 2023.

title: The World Could Soon Have Its First Trillionaire as Inequality Worsens, Oxfam Reports
description: While nearly 5 billion people became poorer since 2020, the world’s five richest men saw their wealth more than double over the same period.

title: Pacific Island Nation of Nauru Severs Ties With Post-Election Taiwan in Favor of China
description: The Pacific Island nation’s move, on the heels of Taiwan’s election, reduces Taiwan’s dwindling number of allies to 12 around the world.

title: Taiwan’s Election Isn’t a Disaster for Xi Jinping—Unless He Makes It One
description: The election demonstrates that Taiwan’s citizens are increasingly inured to bullying, although any departure from those tactics would indicate that improved relations are possible.

title: Israeli Soccer Player in Turkey Suspended, Investigated for Referencing Hamas’ Hostages
description: Sagiv Jehezkel celebrated a goal by pointing to “100 days” scrawled on his wrist, referring to the duration hostages have been held in Gaza.

title: North Korea Claims to Have Tested a Solid-Fuel Missile With a Hypersonic Warhead
description: North Korea said it flight-tested a new solid-fuel intermediate-range missile tipped with a hypersonic warhead in its first ballistic test of 2024.

title: U.S. Fighter Jet Shoots Down Missile That Houthi Rebels Fired at U.S. Warship
description: The conflict with the Houthis threatens to widen the Israel-Hamas war into a regional conflagration.

title: Breaking Down the True Detective: Night Country Premiere—And Its Possible Supernatural Twist
description: The first episode of 'True Detective' Season 4 introduces a deadly Arctic mystery—with a possible supernatural twist.

title: Oppenheimer and Barbie Take Top Prizes at Critics Choice Awards: See All the Winners
description: Summer blockbusters 'Oppenheimer' and 'Barbie' raked in accolades across multiple award categories.

title: The Honeymooners Actress Joyce Randolph Dies at Age 99
description: Randolph, who played Ed Norton’s wife Trixie, was the last surviving main character of the beloved comedy from TV’s golden age of the 1950s.

title: Protests Erupt in Guatemala After Congress Delays President-Elect’s Inauguration
description: President-elect Bernardo Arévalo’s inauguration was tinged by legal wrangling and tensions, just like almost every day since his resounding Aug. 20 election victory.
